trans-unit.source: Prayers
trans-unit.target: Prayers

trans-unit.source: The 12 Steps
trans-unit.target: The 12 Steps

trans-unit.source: The 12 Traditions
trans-unit.target: The 12 Traditions

trans-unit.source: From Date:
trans-unit.target: From Date:

trans-unit.source: To Date:
trans-unit.target: To Date:

trans-unit.source: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can and the wisdom to know the difference.
trans-unit.target: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can and the wisdom to know the difference.

trans-unit.source: Serenity Prayer
trans-unit.target: Serenity Prayer

trans-unit.source: Dear Higher Power, I pray I may continue: To grow in understanding and effectiveness; To take daily spot check inventories of myself; To correct mistakes when I make them; To take responsibility for my actions; To be ever aware of my negative and self-defeating attitudes and behaviors; To keep my willfulness in check; To always remember I need Your help; To keep love and tolerance of others as my code; And to continue in daily prayer how I can best serve You, My Higher Power.
trans-unit.target: Dear Higher Power, I pray I may continue: To grow in understanding and effectiveness; To take daily spot check inventories of myself; To correct mistakes when I make them; To take responsibility for my actions; To be ever aware of my negative and self-defeating attitudes and behaviors; To keep my willfulness in check; To always remember I need Your help; To keep love and tolerance of others as my code; And to continue in daily prayer how I can best serve You, My Higher Power.

trans-unit.source: Dear Higher Power, I pray to keep my connection with You open and clear from the confusion of daily life. Through my prayers and meditation I ask especially for freedom from self-will, rationalization, and wishful thinking. I pray for the guidance of correct thought and positive action. Your will, Higher Power, not mine, be done.
trans-unit.target: Dear Higher Power, I pray to keep my connection with You open and clear from the confusion of daily life. Through my prayers and meditation I ask especially for freedom from self-will, rationalization, and wishful thinking. I pray for the guidance of correct thought and positive action. Your will, Higher Power, not mine, be done.

trans-unit.source: Dear Higher Power, my spiritual awakening continues to unfold. The help I have received I shall pass on and give to others, both in and out of the Fellowship. For this opportunity I am grateful. I pray most humbly to continue walking day by day on the road of spiritual progress. I pray for the inner strength and wisdom to practice the principles of this way of life in all I do and say. I need You, my friends, and the program every hour of every day. This is a better way to live.
trans-unit.target: Dear Higher Power, my spiritual awakening continues to unfold. The help I have received I shall pass on and give to others, both in and out of the Fellowship. For this opportunity I am grateful. I pray most humbly to continue walking day by day on the road of spiritual progress. I pray for the inner strength and wisdom to practice the principles of this way of life in all I do and say. I need You, my friends, and the program every hour of every day. This is a better way to live.

trans-unit.source: Dear Higher Power, my name is ____. I'm a real alcoholic... and I need your help today.
trans-unit.target: Dear Higher Power, my name is ____. I'm a real alcoholic... and I need your help today.

trans-unit.source: Dear Higher Power, I'm standing at the turning point right now. Give me your protection and care as I abandon myself to you and give up my old ways and my old ideas just for today.
trans-unit.target: Dear Higher Power, I'm standing at the turning point right now. Give me your protection and care as I abandon myself to you and give up my old ways and my old ideas just for today.

trans-unit.source: Dear Higher Power, I offer myself to Thee to build with me and to do with me as Thou wilt. Relieve me of the bondage of self, that I may better do Thy will. Take away my difficulties, that victory over them may bear witness to those I would help of Thy Power, Thy Love, and Thy Way of life. May I do Thy will always.
trans-unit.target: Dear Higher Power, I offer myself to Thee to build with me and to do with me as Thou wilt. Relieve me of the bondage of self, that I may better do Thy will. Take away my difficulties, that victory over them may bear witness to those I would help of Thy Power, Thy Love, and Thy Way of life. May I do Thy will always.

trans-unit.source: Dear Higher Power, It is I who has made my life a mess. I have done it, but I cannot undo it. My mistakes are mine and I will begin a searching and fearless moral inventory. I will write down my wrongs but I will also include that which is good. I pray for the strength to complete the task.
trans-unit.target: Dear Higher Power, It is I who has made my life a mess. I have done it, but I cannot undo it. My mistakes are mine and I will begin a searching and fearless moral inventory. I will write down my wrongs but I will also include that which is good. I pray for the strength to complete the task.

trans-unit.source: Dear Higher Power, My inventory has shown me who I am, Yet I ask for Your help in admitting my wrongs to another person and to You. Assure me, and be with me, in this step, for without this Step I cannot progress in my recovery. With Your help, I can do this, and I do it.
trans-unit.target: Dear Higher Power, My inventory has shown me who I am, Yet I ask for Your help in admitting my wrongs to another person and to You. Assure me, and be with me, in this step, for without this Step I cannot progress in my recovery. With Your help, I can do this, and I do it.

trans-unit.source: Dear Higher Power, I am ready for Your help in removing from me the defects of character which I now realize are an obstacle to my recovery. Help me to continue being honest with myself and guide me toward spiritual and mental health.
trans-unit.target: Dear Higher Power, I am ready for Your help in removing from me the defects of character which I now realize are an obstacle to my recovery. Help me to continue being honest with myself and guide me toward spiritual and mental health.

trans-unit.source: Dear Higher Power, I am now willing that you should have all of me, good and bad. I pray that you now remove from me every single defect of character which stands in the way of my usefulness to you and my fellows. Grant me strength, as I go out from here to do your bidding.
trans-unit.target: Dear Higher Power, I am now willing that you should have all of me, good and bad. I pray that you now remove from me every single defect of character which stands in the way of my usefulness to you and my fellows. Grant me strength, as I go out from here to do your bidding.

trans-unit.source: Dear Higher Power, I ask Your help in making my list of all those I have harmed. I will take responsibility for my mistakes and be forgiving to others as You are forgiving to me. Grant me the willingness to begin my restitution. This I pray.
trans-unit.target: Dear Higher Power, I ask Your help in making my list of all those I have harmed. I will take responsibility for my mistakes and be forgiving to others as You are forgiving to me. Grant me the willingness to begin my restitution. This I pray.

trans-unit.source: Dear Higher Power, I pray for the right attitude to make my amends, being ever mindful not to harm others in the process. I ask for Your guidance in making indirect amends. Most important, I will continue to make amends by staying abstinent, helping others and growing in spiritual progress.
trans-unit.target: Dear Higher Power, I pray for the right attitude to make my amends, being ever mindful not to harm others in the process. I ask for Your guidance in making indirect amends. Most important, I will continue to make amends by staying abstinent, helping others and growing in spiritual progress.

trans-unit.target: 10th Step Prayer

trans-unit.source: Step 9
trans-unit.target: Step 9

trans-unit.source: Continued to take personal inventory and when we were wrong promptly admitted it.
trans-unit.target: Continued to take personal inventory and when we were wrong promptly admitted it.

trans-unit.source: Sought through prayer and meditation to improve our conscious contact with God, as we understood Him, praying only for knowledge of His will for us and the power to carry that out.
trans-unit.target: Sought through prayer and meditation to improve our conscious contact with God, as we understood Him, praying only for knowledge of His will for us and the power to carry that out.

trans-unit.source: Having had a spiritual awakening as the result of these Steps, we tried to carry this message to other alcoholics, and to practice these principles in all our affairs.
trans-unit.target: Having had a spiritual awakening as the result of these Steps, we tried to carry this message to other alcoholics, and to practice these principles in all our affairs.

trans-unit.source: We admitted we were powerless over alcohol - that our lives had become unmanageable.
trans-unit.target: We admitted we were powerless over alcohol - that our lives had become unmanageable.

trans-unit.source: Came to believe that a Power greater than ourselves could restore us to sanity.
trans-unit.target: Came to believe that a Power greater than ourselves could restore us to sanity.

trans-unit.source: Made a decision to turn our will and our lives over to the care of God as we understood Him.
trans-unit.target: Made a decision to turn our will and our lives over to the care of God as we understood Him.

trans-unit.source: Made a searching and fearless moral inventory of ourselves.
trans-unit.target: Made a searching and fearless moral inventory of ourselves.

trans-unit.source: Admitted to God, to ourselves and to another human being the exact nature of our wrongs.
trans-unit.target: Admitted to God, to ourselves and to another human being the exact nature of our wrongs.

trans-unit.source: Were entirely ready to have God remove all these defects of character.
trans-unit.target: Were entirely ready to have God remove all these defects of character.

trans-unit.source: Humbly asked Him to remove our shortcomings.
trans-unit.target: Humbly asked Him to remove our shortcomings.

trans-unit.source: Made a list of all persons we had harmed, and became willing to make amends to them all.
trans-unit.target: Made a list of all persons we had harmed, and became willing to make amends to them all.

trans-unit.source: Made direct amends to such people wherever possible, except when to do so would injure them or others.
trans-unit.target: Made direct amends to such people wherever possible, except when to do so would injure them or others.

trans-unit.source: Tradition 1
trans-unit.target: Tradition 1

trans-unit.source: Tradition 10
trans-unit.target: Tradition 10

trans-unit.source: Alcoholics Anonymous has no opinion on outside issues; hence the A.A. name ought never be drawn into public controversy.
trans-unit.target: Alcoholics Anonymous has no opinion on outside issues; hence the A.A. name ought never be drawn into public controversy.

trans-unit.source: Tradition 11
trans-unit.target: Tradition 11

trans-unit.source: Our public relations policy is based on attraction rather than promotion; we need always maintain personal anonymity at the level of press, radio, and films.
trans-unit.target: Our public relations policy is based on attraction rather than promotion; we need always maintain personal anonymity at the level of press, radio, and films.

trans-unit.source: Tradition 12
trans-unit.target: Tradition 12

trans-unit.source: Anonymity is the spiritual foundation of all our Traditions, ever reminding us to place principles before personalities.
trans-unit.target: Anonymity is the spiritual foundation of all our Traditions, ever reminding us to place principles before personalities.

trans-unit.source: Our common welfare should come first; personal recovery depends upon A.A. unity.
trans-unit.target: Our common welfare should come first; personal recovery depends upon A.A. unity.

trans-unit.source: Tradition 2
trans-unit.target: Tradition 2

trans-unit.source: For our group purpose there is but one ultimate authority—a loving God as He may express Himself in our group conscience. Our leaders are but trusted servants; they do not govern.
trans-unit.target: For our group purpose there is but one ultimate authority—a loving God as He may express Himself in our group conscience. Our leaders are but trusted servants; they do not govern.

trans-unit.source: Tradition 3
trans-unit.target: Tradition 3

trans-unit.source: The only requirement for A.A. membership is a desire to stop drinking.
trans-unit.target: The only requirement for A.A. membership is a desire to stop drinking.

trans-unit.source: Tradition 4
trans-unit.target: Tradition 4

trans-unit.source: Each group should be autonomous except in matters affecting other groups or A.A. as a whole.
trans-unit.target: Each group should be autonomous except in matters affecting other groups or A.A. as a whole.

trans-unit.source: Tradition 5
trans-unit.target: Tradition 5

trans-unit.source: Each group has but one primary purpose—to carry its message to the alcoholic who still suffers.
trans-unit.target: Each group has but one primary purpose—to carry its message to the alcoholic who still suffers.

trans-unit.source: Tradition 6
trans-unit.target: Tradition 6

trans-unit.source: An A.A. group ought never endorse, finance, or lend the A.A. name to any related facility or outside enterprise, lest problems of money, property, and prestige divert us from our primary purpose.
trans-unit.target: An A.A. group ought never endorse, finance, or lend the A.A. name to any related facility or outside enterprise, lest problems of money, property, and prestige divert us from our primary purpose.

trans-unit.source: Tradition 7
trans-unit.target: Tradition 7

trans-unit.source: Every A.A. group ought to be fully self-supporting, declining outside contributions.
trans-unit.target: Every A.A. group ought to be fully self-supporting, declining outside contributions.

trans-unit.source: Tradition 8
trans-unit.target: Tradition 8

trans-unit.source: Alcoholics Anonymous should remain forever nonprofessional, but our service centers may employ special workers.
trans-unit.target: Alcoholics Anonymous should remain forever nonprofessional, but our service centers may employ special workers.

trans-unit.source: Tradition 9
trans-unit.target: Tradition 9

trans-unit.source: A.A., as such, ought never be organized; but we may create service boards or committees directly responsible to those they serve.
trans-unit.target: A.A., as such, ought never be organized; but we may create service boards or committees directly responsible to those they serve.

trans-unit.source: If the application is not launched for 2 weeks, the Live Tile will stop updating. This is a Windows Phone OS restriction. You must re-launch, re-select your date from 'Days Since' and re-select the 'Show on Live Tile' checkbox again.
trans-unit.target: If the application is not launched for 2 weeks, the Live Tile will stop updating. This is a Windows Phone OS restriction. You must re-launch, re-select your date from 'Days Since' and re-select the 'Show on Live Tile' checkbox again.

trans-unit.source: Information in this application is not collected or distributed and is meant only for your viewing pleasure.
trans-unit.target: Information in this application is not collected or distributed and is meant only for your viewing pleasure.

trans-unit.source: The Live Tile gets updated every half hour after power-up. So if the 'Days Since' count is off, wait half an hour for it to update correctly.
trans-unit.target: The Live Tile gets updated every half hour after power-up. So if the 'Days Since' count is off, wait half an hour for it to update correctly.
